error.signature: Error from server (Forbidden): error when creating: exceeded quota

verdict.summary: Namespace resource quota exceeded. Cannot create more pods/services/etc.

dead_ends.why_fails: Quota exists for a reason â€” may be enforced by platform team

dead_ends.action: Create resources in a different namespace

workarounds.action: Check current quota usage: kubectl describe quota -n <namespace>
Request quota increase from cluster admin
workarounds.how:
# Check current quota usage:
kubectl describe resourcequota -n <namespace>

# Request increase (edit the ResourceQuota):
kubectl edit resourcequota <quota-name> -n <namespace>
# Or ask cluster admin to update:
# spec.hard.requests.cpu: "20"
# spec.hard.requests.memory: "40Gi"

workarounds.action: Clean up unused resources (completed jobs, old deployments)

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Error from server (Forbidden)' is a quota_error error while 'Error' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
